text: Communist-controlled China refers to the regions of China that were under the control of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) from 1927 to 1949 during the Chinese Civil War. The areas under CCP control were known as revolutionary base areas, and were also called the Soviet Zone from 1927 to 1937, Anti- Japanese Base Areas during the Second Sino-Japanese War, and the Liberated Zone during the final stages of the Civil War. == References == Category:20th century in China
